posts.name: Lunar Robotics 9075
posts.cooked:
Hi! Team 9075 here. We’ve been having issues with two of our SparkMax’s, (henceforth referred to as #7 and #8 ), while working on our competition robot for this past season for showcasing and code work. Our robot is a swerve drive, and both affected SparkMax’s are on the same MK4i module.

Currently, #7 and #8 do not show up in our REV Hardware client. Following the advice of other CD topics, we have tried to put them into recovery mode (which makes them show up again) and redownload the firmware - however, when the update is about to finish, they disapear from REV Hardware Client again and remain undetectable until put into recovery mode again.

Lights are on, they receive power fine, and CAN network is otherwise unaffected - we can see everything except for #7 and #8 . REV Client is updated to the latest release, and all SparkMax’s are fully updated to 24.0.1.

In recovery mode, we’ve tried to send several different updates to #7 and #8 , including the most recent update (aforementioned 24.0.1).

Any help on this would be very appreciated. Should I contact REV support? Apologies for any mistakes, I have never used CD before.

Thank you!

posts.name: Andrew McBride
posts.cooked: Definitely recommend reaching out to REV support, they are always very helpful and quite responsive.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: Yeah you should reach out to rev support but this screams can wiring issue. can you separating them and see if the issue persists?

posts.name: Technologyman00
posts.cooked: Have you tried programming them with a different computer? Windows drivers can be weird sometimes

posts.name: Allen Nuttle
posts.cooked: Update firmware with the USB cable plugged directly into these MAXen and then double check that you don’t have green/yellow reversed on this swerve module.  It’s highly likely that you are seeing a CAN issue of some sort.

posts.name: Tim Winters
posts.cooked: Any issue I had with rev hardware client was solved by switching to another computer. I don’t know why, could be a driver thing, but some of our laptops would not be able to flash firmware, even in recovery mode, ever. When we switched to ‘the good laptop’, everything worked just fine on the previously bad spark maxes.

posts.name: Lunar Robotics 9075
posts.cooked:
Swapped to another one of our coding laptops, and everything works fine, and everything can be detected perfectly.

We did check the CAN wires, but we had already disconnected both SparkMax’s completely from the existing network and from each other, and there was no other observable problem with CAN .

Thank you everyone for the quick replies and the help!

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

suggested_topics.fancy_title: Krackens and sensor suddenly not showing up
suggested_topics.title: Krackens and sensor suddenly not showing up
suggested_topics.excerpt: We found it after hours and hours. One of our zipties was pulled too tight, it cut into the casing of the wire. After we replaced it everything worked fine again.
